title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Clocks, LLC. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Shiny App on Google Cloud Run
text: Badges Overview Installation Usage Pre-Requisites Code Conduct

title: Shiny App on Google Cloud Run
text: repository contains R package demonstrates build deploy R Shiny app Google Cloud Platform’s (GCP) Cloud Run service using Docker.

title: Shiny App on Google Cloud Run
text: can install development version rshinycloudrun GitHub preferred installation method : Notice although R package named rshinycloudrun, GitHub repository named demo-rshiny-cloudrun. internal organization purposes affect installation process.
code: # Install using remotes remotes::install_github("noclocks/demo-rshiny-cloudrun")  # Or using devtools devtools::install_github("noclocks/demo-rshiny-cloudrun")  # Or using pak pak::pkg_install("noclocks/demo-rshiny-cloudrun")

title: Shiny App on Google Cloud Run
text: installed, can load package run Shiny app using following commands:

title: Shiny App on Google Cloud Run
text: package set build deploy R Shiny app Google Cloud Platform’s (GCP) Cloud Run service using Docker.

title: Shiny App on Google Cloud Run
text: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Account Docker Desktop R RStudio R Shiny Google Cloud SDK Google Cloud Run

title: App Sys — app_sys
text: Access files current app.

title: App Sys — app_sys
text: ... (Optional) Character Vector(s) specifying paths file(s) within R package's installation folder. Defaults nothing returns root app package folder.

title: App Sys — app_sys
text: Character vector positive length, containing file paths   matched `...`, empty string, `""`, none matched.

title: App Sys — app_sys
code: config_file <- app_sys("config/config.yml") #> Error in app_sys("config/config.yml"): could not find function "app_sys"

title: Get App Config — get_app_config
text: Retrieves value app package's configuration file, `config.yml`.

title: Get App Config — get_app_config
code: get_app_config(   value,   config = Sys.getenv("APP_CONFIG_ACTIVE", Sys.getenv("R_CONFIG_ACTIVE", "default")),   use_parent = TRUE,   file = app_sys("config.yml") )

title: Get App Config — get_app_config
text: value (Required) Value retrieve config file. config (Optional) Configuration environment use. Defaults `APP_CONFIG_ACTIVE`'s environment variable, available, , uses `R_CONFIG_ACTIVE`'s environment variable. Finally still unset, defaults `default`. use_parent (Optional) Logical, scan parent directory config file. Defaults `TRUE`. file (Optional) Character path location config file. Defaults `config.yml` file app package's root installation directory via `app_sys("config.yml")`.

title: Get App Config — get_app_config
text: value config file.

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass app_opts.
